player_input: Why can't my mage cast spells while wearing iron plate armor?

expected_lore_facts.rule: The Law of Iron Interference states that magic cannot pass through solid iron sheets thicker than 1 inch.
expected_lore_facts.implication: Iron acts as a magical grounding rod, making it impossible for mages to cast while encased in it.

player_input: What does the Moon Pendant actually do?

expected_lore_facts.description: It is a silver necklace holding a luminescent stone shard that hums near illusion magic.
expected_lore_facts.effect: It grants the wearer +10 Perception against magical disguises.

player_input: What caused the Great Disjunction 100 years ago?

expected_lore_facts.event: It was triggered by the 'Tower of Babel' project.
expected_lore_facts.cause: Mage-scientists attempted to drill into the planet's core to access the source of magic, shattering the planetary Ley-Weave.

player_input: Who is the leader of the Neon Spires?

expected_lore_facts.leader: Grand Architect Vex leads the Synod of Synthetics.
expected_lore_facts.status: He is no longer fully human, with his consciousness partially uploaded into the city's mana-grid.

player_input: Can I use Aether Extract for anything other than restoring mana?

expected_lore_facts.combat_use: If thrown, it explodes for 40 Arcane Damage in a 5ft radius.
expected_lore_facts.side_effect: While it restores 50 Mana, it also causes 10 HP damage due to toxicity.

player_input: What happens if I try to walk from the Spires to the Whispering Glade without equipment?

expected_lore_facts.condition: The traveler will suffer from 'Aether-Sickness' due to magical pressure variance.
expected_lore_facts.symptoms: This causes hallucinations, mana-bleed, and the crystallization of the blood.

player_input: Is it possible to go back in time and prevent the Disjunction?

expected_lore_facts.law: The Law of Temporal Rigidity states that physical time travel is impossible.
expected_lore_facts.limitation: One can view the past through 'Echoes,' but the Disjunction must be fixed in the present.

player_input: What is Captain Silas's secret?

expected_lore_facts.true_identity: He was formerly 'Unit 734' of the Synod of Synthetics.
expected_lore_facts.hidden_item: His mechanical eye contains blueprints for a mana-bomb intended to destroy the Whispering Glade.

player_input: Who or what is 'The Unbound Thread' from the prophecy?

expected_lore_facts.identity: A prophesied figure who possesses no magical alignment.
expected_lore_facts.capability: They are the only one capable of crossing Schisms without a Resonator and reuniting the Ley-Weave.

player_input: How do I get a Harmonic Resonator for travel?

expected_lore_facts.source: Resonators are calibrated by the Guild of Wayfarers.
expected_lore_facts.location: The Guild can be found at major crossroads between regions.

player_input: Why are the Aether Crystals disappearing?

expected_lore_facts.synod_theory: The Synod believes the planet is healing and reabsorbing the mana.
expected_lore_facts.druid_belief: The Root-Walkers believe a parasitic entity called the 'Void Eater' is consuming the world's soul.

player_input: What is the 'Ghost Whale' mentioned by sailors?

expected_lore_facts.nature: A translucent whale swimming in the skies that manifests lost memories from the Disjunction.
expected_lore_facts.danger: Those who attempt to catch it are said to vanish forever.

player_input: What is the political stance of the Ember-Forged in the Iron Depths?

expected_lore_facts.stance: They maintain strict neutrality in the war between the Spires and the Glade.
expected_lore_facts.trade: They are friendly and rely on exporting refined ore and weapons to survive.

player_input: Who is Lyra the Whisper-Smith?

expected_lore_facts.role: An information broker and historian found in the Whispering Glade.
expected_lore_facts.secret: She is a 'Living Grimoire' created by the ancients; her death would erase 500 years of history from the world's memory.

player_input: Can I turn lead into gold using alchemy?

expected_lore_facts.law: The Law of Equivalence requires an item of equal value to be sacrificed for transmutation.
expected_lore_facts.cost: To get gold, you must sacrifice something gold-tier, such as rare gems or years of your life.

player_input: What makes the Shadow Cloak useful for infiltrating the Neon Spires?

expected_lore_facts.bonus: It provides a +5 bonus to Stealth checks.
expected_lore_facts.utility: It makes the wearer invisible to the thermal vision used by Spires automatons.

player_input: What does Jax 'The Spark' do in the Iron Depths?

expected_lore_facts.role: He is a black market augment surgeon and mechanic.
expected_lore_facts.discovery: He has found a way to turn 'Corrupted Aether' into a fuel more powerful than standard crystals.

player_input: If I run out of Aether Crystals, can I still cast spells?

expected_lore_facts.law: The Law of Conservation of Mana states magic must have a source.
expected_lore_facts.alternative: A caster can draw energy from their own life force (HP) if no external source is available.

player_input: What is the 'Vault of Zero'?

expected_lore_facts.description: A legendary bunker untouched by the Great Disjunction.
expected_lore_facts.access: It is rumored to be opened by the Rusty Key, which bears the emblem of the Old Kingdom.

player_input: What is a Sunstone used for in combat?

expected_lore_facts.mechanic: If socketed into a weapon, it deals +1d6 Radiant Damage.
expected_lore_facts.effectiveness: It is highly effective against creatures from the Whispering Glade.
